title: Ukraine Plans Evacuations in Kherson and Mykolaiv
description: The government is making plans to evacuate residents who want to leave from Kherson and Mykolaiv, where fighting has badly damaged the infrastructure.

title: Your Monday Briefing: The World Cup Kicks Off
description: Plus COP27 ends with a landmark deal and Twitter reinstates Donald Trump’s account.

title: Canada Imposes Sanctions on Haiti’s Former Leader and Other Officials
description: Among the six targeted over possible ties to criminal gangs were former President Michel Martelly and two former prime ministers.

title: Videos Suggest Captive Russian Soldiers Were Killed at Close Range
description: Videos circulating online and reported on by Russian state media have raised questions about whether Ukrainian soldiers committed a war crime.

title: Videos Suggest Captive Russian Soldiers Were Killed at Close Range
description: Videos circulating online and reported on by Russian state media have raised questions about whether Ukrainian soldiers committed a war crime.

title: Inmates Who Killed a Writer and a Publisher Escape in Bangladesh
description: Men convicted of fatally stabbing the Bangladeshi-American author Avijit Roy and his publisher fled custody in an unsettling reminder of extremist violence against intellectuals.

title: Turkey Bombs Kurdish Foes in Iraq and Syria, Likely Killing Dozens
description: Turkish officials said the airstrikes were a counterterrorism operation against militants it accused of carrying out a bomb attack in Istanbul.

title: At Least 437 Children Have Been Killed Since February, Ukraine says.
description: Andriy Kostin, Ukraine’s prosecutor general, said that the true numbers were likely to be far higher.

title: Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant Endures More Shelling
description: The United Nations’ nuclear watchdog agency called the strikes “extremely disturbing.”

title: Ukraine Will Help Kherson Residents Leave Before Winter
description: Kyiv says it will begin a “voluntary evacuation” of the recently recaptured city of Kherson, much of which is without water, power or heat.

title: A Contentious World Cup
description: Concerns about corruption and human rights loom over a typically joyous sporting event.

title: At Least 5 Killed in Nightclub Shooting in Colorado Springs
description: The police said a suspect in the shooting, who was also injured, had been taken into custody.

title: In Iraq’s Mountains, Iranian Opposition Fighters Feel the Squeeze
description: The armed groups, which have trained in the Kurdistan region for decades, face attacks from Iran and pressure from the Iraqi government to give up their weapons.

title: In Iraq’s Mountains, Iranian Opposition Fighters Feel the Squeeze
description: The armed groups, which have trained in the Kurdistan region for decades, face attacks from Iran and pressure from the Iraqi government to give up their weapons.

title: U.N. Climate Talks End With a Deal to Pay Poor Nations for Damage
description: Nations reached a landmark deal to compensate developing nations for climate harm. But some leaders said the summit didn’t go far enough in addressing the root causes of global warming.

title: As Climate Protests Get Bolder, British Police Strike Back With New Powers
description: New rules curtailing protests have alarmed some who fear an erosion of civil rights. They come as environmental protesters have intensified their tactics to draw attention to climate change.

title: Malaysian Election Adds New Turmoil: Hung Parliament
description: The country has been hit by a series of political shocks in recent years and now confronts the first hung Parliament in its history.
